questions.question_text: Where can a user's public ssh key be added on the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Console in order to execute API calls? (Choose the best answer.)

choices.B: SSH keys cannot be added from console. They have to be added using REST APIs only.
choices.D: Navigate to Identity, select Users panel on the console and select ג€Add Public Keyג€.
choices.A: SSH keys are not required in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.

questions.question_text: Which statement is NOT correct when setting up compartment quotas? (Choose the best answer.)

choices.C: Compartment quotas are set by Oracle.
choices.A: Compartment quotas use policies that allow allocation of resources with a high level of flexibility.
choices.B: Along with compartment budgets, compartment quotas create a powerful toolset to manage your spending.
choices.D: There are three types of quota policy statements which are set, unset and zero.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is the answer.

The statement that is NOT correct when setting up compartment quotas in Oracle Cloud is:

C. Compartment quotas are set by Oracle.

This statement is incorrect because compartment quotas are set by the customers themselves, not by Oracle. Customers can set quotas on the amount of resources that can be used by a compartment, such as CPU, memory, storage, and network bandwidth. By setting quotas, customers can control the resource usage of their compartments and prevent unexpected charges.

The other statements are correct. Compartment quotas use policies that allow allocation of resources with a high level of flexibility, and along with compartment budgets, compartment quotas create a powerful toolset to manage spending. There are three types of quota policy statements which are set, unset, and zero.
C is the appropriate answer here
C in the answer

The question is
"Which statement is NOT correct when setting up compartment quotas? "
Pay attention to "NOT"
Now refer the link from documentation. 
https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/General/Concepts/resourcequotas.htm
C is the right answer.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about using an Autonomous Database with Private Endpoints? (Choose two.)

choices.A: The source file will be automatically removed after the DBMS_CLOUD.COPY_DATA procedure finishes successfully.
choices.C: The target table will be created in Autonomous Database if it does not already exist.
choices.D: The source file can be in either Oracle Standard Storage or Oracle Archive Storage bucket in the Object Store.
choices.E: A valid credential must be created prior to running the DBMS_CLOUD.COPY_DATA procedure.
choices.B: The source files can reside in Oracle Object Storage, Amazon S3 Object storage, or Azure Blob storage.

discussion.content:
